title: Corporate Branding Photography (Steve MJoseph)
text: By Steve MJoseph Oct 12, 2015 No matter the size of your business, having a professional look is important in representing your company as a knowledgeable, qualified and capable organization. In portraying your board members and staff, it is more professional and effective to have all the headshots in a similar environment. This ensures that the power of photography is used to communicate everything about the brand. Importance of Branding Images In business, your branded image is far more important than your tagline or your logo that represents your company. A branded image plays an important role in embodying your company in the minds of your clients. Photography is found everywhere in the corporate world, from the portraits to the stock photos seen on the company's website. An expert photographer can help you build your brand identity through his techniques and skills. A portrait photo should be able to show how approachable and confident you are. The corporate photography that is used in branding involves images that appear in brochures and on the websites as well as the social media. These images include business headshots of team photos, images of the environment in the office, photos of company leaders and corporate meetings and events that can be uploaded on Facebook and Twitter or used in pubic endeavors. Photography that is used for corporate branding begins with company leaders as well as other employees and personnel coming to a mutual agreement. The photographer that is used should be creative with the images so that the customers can feel a connection. Benefits of Corporate Branding ● Present quality products and services ● Helps in standing out from the competition ● Helps in immersing the audience How to Choose for the Best Corporate Branding Photographer When searching for a corporate photographer it is important to realize that there are various styles of photography. Doing a search for photographers leaves you with a broad list of baby and wedding photographers who in most cases don't deal with corporate identity. Once you have narrowed down to the type of the photographer you want, you take a look at their portfolios and choose the one that blends well with your identity. When speaking to the photographers you should request for their samples to see how consistent they are. In case you want to get portraits for many people you should ask for bulk portraits they have done for their clients. When planning for a multiday gala or conference you should ask for a gallery similar to what you want. This prepares you for what you expect at the end of the job and an opportunity to voice your concerns. After finding the right person for corporate branding photography to help you in updating your brand identity you can finally discuss the details and fees. At this stage it is also important to mention up front and work out the details for instance if you want to turn your images into billboards. When discussing the cost and their fees on the assignment, it is also important to discuss the entire assignment including the rights to retain the images.
